dct_title_s: This is the map of the land sold by the tribe of the Ngaitahu to William Wakefield for the New Zealand Company, done at Akaroa on the 12th day of June 1848
dct_description_sm: a true copy, Chas. Heaphy, draftsman.
Covers middle portion of South Island.
"Enclosure 7 in no. 22, in Governor Grey's despatch, no. 80 of 25th Augt. 1848."
Publisher's no. from its catalog of nineteenth century maps of New Zealand from the British Parliamentary papers: 20.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Map Collections courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact Branner Earth Sciences Library & Map Collections at brannerlibrary@stanford.edu.
